00033 template <typename II1, typename II2>
00034 bool less_than_digits(II1 b1, II1 e1, II2 b2, II2 e2)
00035 {
00036         unsigned int s1_len, s2_len;
00037 
00038         s1_len = distance(b1, e1);
00039         s2_len = distance(b2, e2);
00040         if (s1_len < s2_len) return true;
00041         if (s1_len > s2_len) return false;
00042 
00043         while (e1 != b1) {
00044                 --e1; --e2;
00045                 if (*e1 > *e2) return false;
00046                 if (*e1 < *e2) return true;
00047         }
00048 
00049         return true;
00050 }

00053 // -----------------
00054 // shift_left_digits
00055 // -----------------
00056 
00071 template <typename II, typename OI>
00072 OI shift_left_digits (II b, II e, int n, OI x) {
00073         if (n < 0) {
00074                 throw std::invalid_argument("My::shift_left_digits: n < 0");
00075         }
00076 
00077         assert(b != e);
00078         // Stream in the least significant zeroes produced by the shift
00079         for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00080                 *x = 0;
00081                 ++x;
00082         }
00083 
00084     while (b != e) {
00085         *x = *b;
00086         ++x; ++b;
00087     }
00088 
00089     return x;
00090 }

00092 // ------------------
00093 // shift_right_digits
00094 // ------------------
00095 
00111 template <typename II, typename OI>
00112 OI shift_right_digits (II b, II e, int n, OI x) {
00113         if (n < 0) {
00114                 throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::shift_right_digits: n < 0");
00115         }
00116 
00117         assert(b != e);
00118         // If the shift is larger than the number of digits, just output 0
00119         if (std::distance(b, e) <= n) {
00120                 *x = 0;
00121                 ++x;
00122                 return x;
00123         }
00124 
00125         std::advance(b, n);
00126         // Then, start copying elements into x, starting at the beginning of where
00127         // b started.  Continue until we run out of input in e.
00128         // If we are already at the end, we have shifted off the end of the input,
00129         // so just output 0.
00130         while (b != e) {
00131                 *x = *b;
00132                 ++x; ++b;
00133         }
00134 
00135     return x;
00136 }

00138 // -----------
00139 // plus_digits
00140 // -----------
00141 
00154 template <typename II1, typename II2, typename OI>
00155 typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type 
00156 add_next_column (II1 &b1, II1 &e1, II2 &b2, II2 &e2, OI &x, 
00157                                  typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type carry)
00158 {
00159         typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type result = carry;
00160         
00161         result = carry;
00162         // If there is more of the first input, add it
00163         if (b1 != e1) {
00164                 result += *b1;
00165                 b1++;
00166         }
00167 
00168         // If there is more of the second input, add it
00169         if (b2 != e2) {
00170                 result += *b2;
00171                 b2++;
00172         }
00173 
00174         // Compute the new carry
00175         carry = 0;
00176         while (result >= 10) {
00177                 result -= 10;
00178                 carry += 1;
00179         }
00180 
00181         // Write the result
00182         *x = result;
00183         ++x;
00184 
00185         return carry;
00186 }
00187 
00188 
00204 template <typename II1, typename II2, typename OI>
00205 OI plus_digits(II1 b1, II1 e1, II2 b2, II2 e2, OI x) {
00206         typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type carry = 0;
00207 
00208     while((b1 != e1) || (b2 != e2) || (carry != 0)) {
00209                 // add the next column of digits; include carry
00210                 carry = add_next_column(b1, e1, b2, e2, x, carry);
00211     }
00212 
00213         return x;
00214         
00215 }

00218 // ------------
00219 // minus_digits
00220 // ------------
00221 template <typename II1, typename II2, typename OI>
00222 typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type 
00223 subtract_next_column (II1 &b1, II1 &e1, II2 &b2, II2 &e2, OI &x, 
00224                                           typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type borrow_in,
00225                                           unsigned int &pending_zeroes)
00226 {
00227         typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type minuend, subtrahend;
00228         typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type result;
00229         typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type borrow_out = 0;
00230 
00231         // Start with the minuend's next digit
00232         assert(b1 != e1);
00233         minuend = *b1;
00234         ++b1;
00235         
00236         // Subtrahend is the sum of the borrow and the next digit of sequence 2,
00237         // if any
00238         subtrahend = borrow_in;
00239         if (b2 != e2) {
00240                 subtrahend += *b2;
00241                 b2++;
00242         }
00243 
00244         // Calculate any needed borrow
00245         borrow_out = 0;
00246         while (minuend < subtrahend) {
00247                 ++borrow_out;
00248                 minuend += 10;
00249         }
00250 
00251         result = minuend - subtrahend;
00252         assert((result) < 10);
00253         assert((result) >= 0);
00254         
00255         if (result == 0) {
00256                 ++pending_zeroes;
00257         } else {
00258                 // Result non-zero; handle pending zeroes
00259                 while (pending_zeroes > 0) {
00260                         *x = 0;
00261                         ++x; --pending_zeroes;
00262                 }
00263                 assert(pending_zeroes == 0);
00264                 *x = result;
00265                 ++x;
00266         }
00267         
00268         return borrow_out;
00269 }

00272 
00290 template <typename II1, typename II2, typename OI>
00291 OI minus_digits (II1 b1, II1 e1, II2 b2, II2 e2, OI x) {
00292         typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type borrow = 0;
00293         unsigned int zeroes = 0;
00294         bool all_zeroes = true;
00295 
00296 
00297         while (b1 != e1) {
00298                 borrow = subtract_next_column(b1, e1, b2, e2, x, borrow, zeroes);
00299                 if (all_zeroes && (zeroes == 0)) all_zeroes = false;
00300         }
00301 
00302         if (all_zeroes) {
00303                 *x = 0;
00304                 x++;
00305         }
00306 
00307         assert(b2 == e2);
00308         assert(borrow == 0);
00309 
00310     return x;
00311 }

00313 // -----------------
00314 // multiplies_digits
00315 // -----------------
00316 
00321 template <typename II, typename T, typename OI>
00322 OI multiply_digit(II b, II e, T digit, OI x)
00323 {
00324         T carry = 0;
00325         T mul_result = 0;
00326 
00327         while (b != e) {
00328                 mul_result = ((*b) * digit) + carry;
00329                 *x              = mul_result % 10;
00330                 carry   = mul_result / 10;
00331                 ++b; ++x;
00332         }
00333 
00334         // Handle final carry out
00335         if (carry) {
00336                 *x = carry;
00337                 ++x;
00338         }
00339         
00340         return x;
00341 }
00342 
00356 template <typename II1, typename II2, typename OI>
00357 OI multiplies_digits (II1 b1, II1 e1, II2 b2, II2 e2, OI x) {
00358         typedef std::vector<typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type> m_vector;
00359         m_vector sum;
00360         m_vector shifted;
00361         m_vector mul;
00362         typename m_vector::iterator sum_end;
00363         typename m_vector::iterator shifted_end;
00364         typename m_vector::iterator mul_end;
00365 
00366         unsigned int shift = 0;
00367         unsigned int s1_size = std::distance(b1, e1);
00368         unsigned int s2_size = std::distance(b2, e2);
00369 
00370         /* Reserve enough space in mul for s1 * 9 */
00371         mul.resize(s1_size + 2, 0);
00372         /* We shift by the number of digits in s2, plus the largest value in s1 */
00373         shifted.resize(s2_size + s1_size + 2, 0);
00374         /* The sum could be the size of the largest shifted number, plus a carry */
00375         sum.resize(s2_size + s1_size + 2 + 1, 0);
00376         sum_end = sum.begin();
00377         
00378         while (b2 != e2) {
00379                 mul_end = multiply_digit(b1, e1, *b2, mul.begin());
00380                 shifted_end = shift_left_digits(mul.begin(), mul_end,
00381                                                                                 shift, shifted.begin());
00382                 sum_end = plus_digits(sum.begin(), sum_end, shifted.begin(),
00383                                                           shifted_end, sum.begin());
00384                 ++shift; ++b2;
00385         }
00386 
00387         for(typename m_vector::iterator it = sum.begin(); it != sum_end; ++it) {
00388                         *x = *it;
00389                         ++x;
00390         }
00391 
00392     return x;
00393 }

00395 // --------------

00399 
00414 template <typename II1, typename II2, typename OI>
00415 OI divides_digits (II1 b1, II1 e1, II2 b2, II2 e2, OI x) {
00416         typedef std::vector<typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type> d_vector;
00417         d_vector numer; /* This one is MOST signaificant first...pay attention */
00418         d_vector denom;
00419         d_vector mul_result;
00420         d_vector prev_mul;
00421         d_vector result;
00422         d_vector tmp;
00423         typename d_vector::iterator tmp_end;
00424         typename d_vector::reverse_iterator out_it;
00425         typename std::iterator_traits<OI>::value_type div_digit;
00426 
00427         /* Will always hold the denominator */
00428         denom.assign(b2, e2);
00429 
00430         // Loop until we run out of numerator
00431         while (e1 != b1) {
00432                 do {
00433                         --e1;
00434                         numer.push_back(*e1);
00435                 } while (less_than_digits(numer.rbegin(), numer.rend(),
00436                                                                   denom.begin(), denom.end()));
00437 
00438                 div_digit = 0;
00439                 prev_mul.clear();
00440                 mul_result.assign(denom.begin(), denom.end());
00441                 do {
00442                         ++div_digit;
00443                         prev_mul = mul_result;
00444                         tmp.clear();
00445                         tmp.resize(mul_result.size() + 1, 0);
00446                         tmp_end = plus_digits(mul_result.begin(), mul_result.end(),
00447                                                           denom.begin(), denom.end(), tmp.begin());
00448                         mul_result.assign(tmp.begin(), tmp_end);
00449                 } while (less_than_digits(mul_result.begin(), mul_result.end(),
00450                                                                   numer.rbegin(), numer.rend()));
00451                 
00452                 result.push_back(div_digit);
00453                 /* Prev_mul now holds the number to be subtracted from numerator */
00454                 tmp.resize(distance(numer.begin(), numer.end()), 0);
00455                 tmp_end = minus_digits(numer.rbegin(), numer.rend(),
00456                                                            prev_mul.begin(), prev_mul.end(), tmp.begin());
00457                 tmp.resize(distance(tmp.begin(), tmp_end));
00458                 numer.assign(tmp.rbegin(), tmp.rend());
00459         }
00460         
00461         out_it = result.rbegin();
00462         while(out_it != result.rend()) {
00463                 *x = *out_it;
00464                 ++x; ++out_it;
00465         }
00466         
00467         return x;
00468 }

00475 template < typename T, typename C = std::vector<T> >
00476 class Integer {
00477     public:
00478         // -----------
00479         // operator ==
00480         // -----------
00481 
00486         friend bool operator == (const Integer& lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00487                         // If called with yourself, this is true
00488                         if (&lhs == &rhs) return true;
00489 
00490             if (lhs.sign != rhs.sign) return false;
00491             if (lhs.container.size() != rhs.container.size()) return false;
00492             //check each element of the container
00493             return (lhs.container == rhs.container);
00494                 }
00495 
00496         // -----------
00497         // operator !=
00498         // -----------
00499 
00503         friend bool operator != (const Integer& lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00504             return !(lhs == rhs);
00505                 }
00506 
00507         // ----------
00508         // operator <
00509         // ----------
00510 
00514         friend bool operator < (const Integer& lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00515                         // Check signs - if they are different, handle this first
00516                         if (!lhs.sign && rhs.sign) return true;
00517                         if (lhs.sign && !rhs.sign) return false;
00518                         // We know all signs are the same; handle size differences
00519             if (lhs.container.size() < rhs.container.size()) return (lhs.sign);
00520                         if (lhs.container.size() > rhs.container.size()) return (!lhs.sign);
00521                         // Same size, same sign - compare all digits until difference
00522                         typename C::const_iterator lhs_it = lhs.container.end();
00523                         typename C::const_iterator rhs_it = rhs.container.end();
00524                         while (lhs_it != lhs.container.begin()) {
00525                                 --lhs_it; --rhs_it;
00526                                 if (*lhs_it > *rhs_it) return (!lhs.sign);
00527                         }
00528                 return (lhs.sign);
00529         }
00530 
00531         // -----------
00532         // operator <=
00533         // -----------
00534 
00538         friend bool operator <= (const Integer& lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00539             return !(rhs < lhs);
00540                 }
00541 
00542         // ----------
00543         // operator >
00544         // ----------
00545 
00549         friend bool operator > (const Integer& lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00550             return (rhs < lhs);
00551                 }
00552 
00553         // -----------
00554         // operator >=
00555         // -----------
00556 
00560         friend bool operator >= (const Integer& lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00561             return !(lhs < rhs);
00562                 }
00563 
00564         // ----------
00565         // operator +
00566         // ----------
00567 
00571         friend Integer operator + (Integer lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00572             return lhs += rhs;
00573                 }
00574 
00575         // ----------
00576         // operator -
00577         // ----------
00578 
00582         friend Integer operator - (Integer lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00583             return lhs -= rhs;
00584                 }
00585 
00586         // ----------
00587         // operator *
00588         // ----------
00589 
00593         friend Integer operator * (Integer lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00594             return lhs *= rhs;
00595                 }
00596 
00597         // ----------
00598         // operator /
00599         // ----------
00600 
00607         friend Integer operator / (Integer lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00608             /*if((rhs.container.size == 1) && (rhs.container[0] == 0)){
00609                 throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::operator /");
00610                 }*/

00612         }

00624                 }
00625

00627         // operator <<

00629 
00633         friend Integer operator << (Integer lhs, int rhs) {
00634             return lhs <<= rhs;
00635                 }
00636 
00637         // -----------
00638         // operator >>
00639         // -----------

00644         friend Integer operator >> (Integer lhs, int rhs) {
00645             return lhs >>= rhs;
00646                 }
00647 
00648         // -----------
00649         // operator <<
00650         // -----------
00651 
00655         friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& lhs, const Integer& rhs) {
00656             typename C::const_iterator rit;
00657                         if (!rhs.sign) lhs << "-";
00658             rit = rhs.container.end();
00659             while(rit != rhs.container.begin()){
00660             --rit;
00661             lhs << *rit;
00662             }
00663             return lhs;
00664                 }
00665 
00666     private:
00667         // data
00668         // ----
00669                 bool sign; // true = positive & false = negative 
00670                 C container;
00671 
00672         // -----
00673         // valid
00674         // -----
00678         bool valid () const {
00679                     typename C::const_iterator it = container.begin();
00680                         // All numbers are 0-9
00681                         // Leading numbers non-zero
00682                         while (it != container.end()) {
00683                                 if (*it < 0 || *it > 9) return false;
00684                                 ++it;
00685                         }
00686                 return true;
00687                 }
00688 
00689     public:
00690         // ------------
00691         // constructors
00692         // ------------
00693 
00700         Integer (int value) {
00701                         // Determine sign, and get absolute value
00702                         if (value < 0) {
00703                                 value = -value;
00704                                 sign = false;
00705                         } else {
00706                                 sign = true;
00707                         }
00708 
00709                         //storing the least significant digit at index 0 and then 
00710                         //continue on storing it backward
00711                         while (value > 0) {
00712                                 container.push_back(value % 10);
00713                                 value = value / 10;
00714                         }
00715                         
00716                         // Handle the 0 special case
00717                         if (container.size() == 0) {
00718                                 container.push_back(0);
00719                         }
00720 
00721             assert(valid());
00722                 }
00723 
00729         explicit Integer (const std::string& value) {
00730             // we are just going to start build the object out of the string
00731                         // value if the input is not valid, the valid() will fails and it
00732                         // will throw the exceptions
00733                 using namespace std;
00734                         unsigned int len = value.length();
00735                         unsigned int count = 0;
00736                 // if it's a negative number
00737                 if(value.at(0)=='-'){
00738                         sign = false;
00739                         len -= 1;
00740                         }
00741                 else{ sign = true;}
00742                         
00743                         container.resize(len, 0);
00744             std::string::const_iterator str_rit = value.end();
00745             typename C::iterator it = container.begin();
00746                         
00747             while(count < len && it != container.end()) {
00748                 --str_rit;
00749                 //*it = std::atoi(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(*str_rit));
00750                 *it = static_cast<T>((*str_rit) - '0');
00751                 ++it; ++count;
00752             }
00753             if (!valid())
00754                 throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::Integer(const std::string& value)");
00755         }
00756         // Default copy, destructor, and copy assignment.
00757         // are provided by the compiler
00758         // Integer (const Integer&);
00759         // ~Integer ();
00760         // Integer& operator = (const Integer&);
00761 
00762         // ----------
00763         // operator -
00764         // ----------
00765 
00770         Integer operator - () const {
00771                         Integer copy = *this;
00772                         if(*this != 0)
00773                         copy.sign = (!copy.sign);
00774                         
00775             return copy;
00776                 }
00777 
00778         // -----------
00779         // operator ++
00780         // -----------
00781 
00786         Integer& operator ++ () {
00787             *this += 1;
00788             return *this;
00789                 }
00790 
00796         Integer operator ++ (int) {
00797             Integer x = *this;
00798             ++(*this);
00799             return x;
00800                 }
00801 
00802         // -----------
00803         // operator --
00804         // -----------
00805

00811             *this -= 1;
00812             return *this;
00813                 }
00814 
00820         Integer operator -- (int) {
00821             Integer x = *this;
00822             --(*this);
00823             return x;
00824                 }
00825 
00826         // -----------
00827         // operator +=
00828         // -----------
00829 
00834         Integer& operator += (const Integer& rhs) {
00835                         if (this->sign != rhs.sign) {
00836                                 if (this->abs() == rhs.abs()) {
00837                                         container.clear();
00838                                         container.push_back(0);
00839                                         sign = true;
00840                                         return *this;
00841                                 }
00842 
00843                                 // Four cases - first, they need to be submitted to minus with
00844                                 // the largest one first; so, if we need to switch their order,
00845                                 // we reverse the sign.
00846                                 // Ex: 9 - 18 = -(18 - 9)
00847                                 // FIXME: Maybe use swap here instead
00848                                 C copy = this->container;
00849                                 typename C::iterator end;
00850                                 if (this->abs() > rhs.abs()) {
00851                                                 end = minus_digits(copy.begin(),
00852                                                                                    copy.end(),
00853                                                                                    rhs.container.begin(),
00854                                                                                    rhs.container.end(),
00855                                                                                    this->container.begin());
00856                                 } else {
00857                                                 end = minus_digits(rhs.container.begin(),
00858                                                                                    rhs.container.end(),
00859                                                                                    copy.begin(),
00860                                                                                    copy.end(),
00861                                                                                    this->container.begin());
00862                                                 this->sign = !this->sign;
00863                                 }
00864                                 this->container.resize(distance(this->container.begin(), end));
00865                         } else {
00866                                 plus_digits(this->container.begin(), this->container.end(),
00867                                                         rhs.container.begin(), rhs.container.end(),
00868                                                         this->container.begin());
00869                         }
00870             return *this;
00871                 }
00872 
00873         // -----------
00874         // operator -=
00875         // -----------
00876 
00881         Integer& operator -= (const Integer& rhs) {
00882                         return ((*this) += -(rhs));
00883                 }
00884                 
00885 
00886         // -----------
00887         // operator *=
00888         // -----------
00889 
00894         Integer& operator *= (const Integer& rhs) {
00895                         if(*this==0 || rhs==0){
00896                                 this->container.clear();
00897                                 this->container.push_back(0);
00898                                 this->sign = true;
00899                                 return *this;
00900                                 }
00901                         typename C::iterator copy_end;
00902                         C copy;
00903                         copy.resize(this->container.size() + rhs.container.size() + 1);
00904                         this->sign = (this->sign == rhs.sign);
00905                         copy_end = multiplies_digits(this->container.begin(),
00906                                                                                  this->container.end(),
00907                                                                          rhs.container.begin(),
00908                                                                                  rhs.container.end(), copy.begin());
00909                         this->container.assign(copy.begin(), copy_end);
00910                         return *this;
00911                 }
00912 
00913         // -----------
00914         // operator /=
00915         // -----------
00916 
00922         Integer& operator /= (const Integer& rhs) {
00923                         typename C::iterator copy_end;
00924             if(rhs == 0) {
00925                 throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::operator /: div by 0");
00926             }
00927                         if(*this==0){
00928                                 return *this;
00929                                 }
00930 
00931                         C copy = this->container;
00932                         this->sign = (this->sign == rhs.sign);
00933                         copy_end = divides_digits(this->container.begin(),
00934                                                                           this->container.end(),
00935                                                                   rhs.container.begin(),
00936                                                                           rhs.container.end(),
00937                                                                   copy.begin());
00938                         
00939                         this->container.assign(copy.begin(), copy_end);
00940             return *this;
00941                 }
00942 
00943         // -----------
00944         // operator %=
00945         // -----------
00946 
00952         Integer& operator %= (const Integer& rhs) {
00953                         Integer copy = *this;
00954             if(rhs <= 0) {
00955                 throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::operator /: div by 0");
00956             }
00957                         if(*this==0){
00958                                 return *this;
00959                                 }
00960 
00961 
00962                         copy = *this - ((*this / rhs) * rhs);
00963                         copy.sign = true;
00964                         if(!this->sign)
00965                                 copy = rhs - copy;
00966                         this->container = copy.container;
00967                         this->sign = copy.sign;
00968                         return *this;
00969                 }
00970 
00971         // ------------
00972         // operator <<=
00973         // ------------
00974 
00979         Integer& operator <<= (int n) {
00980             int i, len;
00981 
00982                         if (n < 0) {
00983                                 throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::operator <<=: n < 0");
00984                         }
00985 
00986                         if (*this != 0) {
00987                                 len = this->container.size();
00988                                 this->container.resize(len + n);
00989                                 for (i = (len - 1); i >= 0; i--) {
00990                                         this->container[i + n] = this->container[i];
00991                                 }
00992 
00993                                 for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00994                                         this->container[i] = 0;
00995                                 }
00996                         }
00997 
00998             return *this;
00999                 }
01000 
01001         // ------------
01002         // operator >>=
01003         // ------------
01004 
01009         Integer& operator >>= (int n) {
01010                         typename C::iterator it;
01011 
01012                         if (n < 0) {
01013                                 throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::operator <<=: n < 0");
01014                         }
01015 
01016                         if ((unsigned int)n >= this->container.size()) {
01017                                 this->container.clear();
01018                                 this->container.push_back(0);
01019                         } else {
01020                                 it = this->container.begin();
01021                                 std::advance(it, n);
01022                                 this->container.erase(this->container.begin(), it);
01023                         }
01024 
01025             return *this;
01026                 }
01027 
01028         // ---
01029         // abs
01030         // ---
01031 
01037         Integer abs () const {
01038                         if (this->sign) {
01039                 Integer copy = *this;
01040                                 return copy;
01041                         } else {
01042                                 return -(*this);
01043                         }
01044                 }
01045 
01046         // ---
01047         // pow
01048         // ---
01049 
01056         Integer pow (int e) const {
01057                         if (e < 0) {
01058                         throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::pow(int e): e < 0");
01059                         }
01060                         
01061                         if (e == 0) {
01062                                 if (*this == 0) {
01063                         throw std::invalid_argument("Integer::pow(int e): 0^0");
01064                                 }
01065                                 return Integer(1);
01066                         }
01067 
01068                         Integer copy = *this;
01069                         C tmp;
01070                         typename C::iterator tmp_end;
01071                         for (int i = 1; i < e; i++) {
01072                                 tmp.resize(copy.container.size() + 1, 0);
01073                                 tmp_end = multiplies_digits(copy.container.begin(),
01074                                                                                     copy.container.end(),
01075                                                                                     this->container.begin(),
01076                                                                                     this->container.end(),
01077                                                                                     tmp.begin());
01078                                 copy.container.assign(tmp.begin(), tmp_end);
01079                                 tmp.clear();
01080                         }
01081                         if ((copy.sign == false) && ((e % 2) == 0)) {
01082                                 copy.sign = true;
01083                         } else {
01084                                 copy.sign = this->sign;
01085                         }
01086         
01087             return copy;
01088                 }
01089         };
